title: Authors and Citation
text: Lu Mao. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mao L (2025). IntCens: Non- Semi-Parametric Analysis Interval-Censored Data. R package version 0.2.0, https://lmaowisc.github.io/IntCens/, https://github.com/lmaowisc/IntCens.
code: @Manual{,   title = {IntCens: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data},   author = {Lu Mao},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0, https://lmaowisc.github.io/IntCens/},   url = {https://github.com/lmaowisc/IntCens}, }

what: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data
title: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data
text: IntCens package provides non- semi-parametric methods analyzing interval-censored data. includes iterative estimation routines proportional hazards proportional odds models, well nonparametric maximum likelihood estimation.

title: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data
text: can install development version IntCens GitHub :

title: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data
text: main function fitting nonparametric, PH, PO models icsurvfit(). basic example:
code: library(IntCens) ## basic example code # A dataset containing interval-censored observations and a treatment indicator  # (radiation vs. radiation plus chemotherapy) data(bcos) n <- nrow(bcos) # sample size # Extract the left and right endpoints of the intervals set.seed(123) L <- bcos$left + rnorm(n, 0, 0.0001) # add random noise R <- bcos$right + rnorm(n, 0, 0.0001) # Covariate (binary) Z <- as.numeric(bcos$treatment == "RadChem")  # Nonparametric obj_np <- icsurvfit(L, R) plot(obj_np, main = "Nonparametric") # Cox model (PH) obj_ph <- icsurvfit(L, R, Z, model = "PH") obj_ph #>  #> Call: #> icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PH") #>  #> NPMLE of proportional hazards for interval-censored data: #>  #> ICM algorithm converges in 21 iterations. #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #>  #>      Estimate  StdErr z.value  p.value    #> [1,]  0.83568 0.30446  2.7448 0.006055 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 # Proportional odds model (PO) obj_po <- icsurvfit(L, R, Z, model = "PO") obj_po #>  #> Call: #> icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PO") #>  #> NPMLE of proportional odds for interval-censored data: #>  #> ICM algorithm converges in 20 iterations. #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #>  #>      Estimate  StdErr z.value p.value   #> [1,]  0.91123 0.41753  2.1824 0.02908 * #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

title: Compute Convex Minorant — CM
text: Computes piecewise-linear convex minorant two numeric vectors G Q iteratively identifying minimum slopes assigning output vector y. method sometimes used isotonic shape-constrained regression contexts.

title: Compute Convex Minorant — CM
text: G Numeric vector \(x\)-coordinates (must length Q). Q Numeric vector \(y\)-coordinates (must length G).

title: Compute Convex Minorant — CM
text: numeric vector y length length(G), giving   slopes values associated convex minorant.

title: Compute Convex Minorant — CM
text: Internally, function calculates slopes segments points G picks minimum slope iteratively, ensuring resulting piecewise-linear function convex.

what: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
text: Computes partial derivatives score components interval-censored data, given current estimates baseline functions regression parameter vector beta. function typically part iterative algorithm semiparametric estimation.

title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
code: CSD.f2(Hf, beta, y, index, delta, gamma, Z)

title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
text: Hf list containing baseline functions related objects (e.g., H, H1, H2). beta numeric vector regression coefficients covariates Z. y numeric vector (often current estimate cumulative baseline hazard similar function) length p. index n x 2 matrix indices referencing positions y subject. delta Numeric (0/1) event indicator left endpoint U. gamma Numeric (0/1) event indicator right endpoint V. Z matrix data frame covariates, n rows (one per subject).

title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
text: list following components: G numeric vector (length p) cumulative increments related gamma. Q numeric vector (length p) combined increments (e.g., dW + y[] * dG).

title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
text: function uses auxiliary routines (e.g., FdG.f(), eta1G.f(), eta2G.f(), zeta1.f(), etc.) compute partial derivatives log-likelihood estimating equations respect y.

title: Compute Score Components for Interval-Censored Data — CSD.f2
code: # (Not run) Example with placeholder data: # Hf <- list(H = NULL, H1 = NULL, H2 = NULL) # beta <- c(0.1, -0.2) # y <- rep(0.05, 5) # index <- matrix(c(1, 2, 2, 3), nrow = 2, byrow = TRUE) # delta <- c(1, 0) # gamma <- c(0, 1) # Z <- matrix(c(1, 0, 0, 1), nrow = 2) # CSD.f2(Hf, beta, y, index, delta, gamma, Z)

what: Compute the CDF Value for epn*y (Internal) — FdG.f
title: Compute the CDF Value for epn*y (Internal) — FdG.f
text: Computes \(1 - H(epn \times y)\), H user-supplied function.

title: Compute the CDF Value for epn*y (Internal) — FdG.f
Compute the CDF Value for epn*y (Internal) — FdG.f
text: epn Numeric value, typically \(\exp(Z \beta)\) similar. y Numeric scalar vector. H function takes one argument (numeric) returns numeric value.

title: Compute the CDF Value for epn*y (Internal) — FdG.f
text: numeric value, \(1 - H(epn \times y)\).

title: Baseline Hazard Function Constructor (Internal) — H.func
text: Given functions G, G1, G2, returns list baseline functions H, H1, H2 used survival hazard calculations.

title: Baseline Hazard Function Constructor (Internal) — H.func
text: G function G(x), e.g., cumulative hazard transform. G1 function, first derivative G. G2 function, second derivative G.

title: Baseline Hazard Function Constructor (Internal) — H.func
text: list three functions: H(x) Computes \(\exp(-G(x))\). H1(x) First derivative H(x). H2(x) Second derivative H(x).

what: Internal Composite Function for Interval Censoring (Internal) — ICSurvICM
title: Internal Composite Function for Interval Censoring (Internal) — ICSurvICM
text: Provides internal composite function runs full iterative procedure fitting interval-censored model, supporting different transformations. Typically called user-facing icsurvfit function.

title: Internal Composite Function for Interval Censoring (Internal) — ICSurvICM
code: ICSurvICM(delta, gamma, U, V, Z, model, maxiter = 500)

title: Internal Composite Function for Interval Censoring (Internal) — ICSurvICM
text: delta, gamma, U, V Numeric vectors representing censoring indicators intervals. Z Matrix data frame covariates. model Character string, one "NP", "PO", "PH". maxiter Maximum number iterations.

title: Internal Composite Function for Interval Censoring (Internal) — ICSurvICM
text: list elements beta, y, t, var, convergence info.

what: IntCens: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data — IntCens-package
title: IntCens: Non- and Semi-Parametric Analysis of Interval-Censored Data — IntCens-package
text: Implements non- semi-parametric methods analyzing interval-censored data. includes iterative estimation routines proportional hazards proportional odds models, well nonparametric maximum likelihood estimation.

title: Newton-Raphson Update for Beta (Internal) — NR2
text: Implements Newton-Raphson step update regression parameter beta using partial derivatives log-likelihood. Internally calls helper functions computing score information matrix components (e.g. xi1G.f).

title: Newton-Raphson Update for Beta (Internal) — NR2
code: NR2(Hf, beta, y, delta, gamma, index, Z, eps = 1e-04, maxiter = 20)

title: Newton-Raphson Update for Beta (Internal) — NR2
text: Hf list functions (H, H1, H2) defining baseline hazard (similar). beta Numeric vector regression coefficients (initial/current guess). y Numeric vector baseline-related parameters (often updated profile1). delta, gamma Numeric 0/1 vectors indicating left interval censoring status. index 2-column integer matrix mapping subject's interval indices y. Z matrix data frame covariates. eps Convergence tolerance updating beta. maxiter Maximum number Newton-Raphson iterations.

title: Newton-Raphson Update for Beta (Internal) — NR2
text: Updated beta numeric vector.

title: Breast Cosmesis Data — bcos
text: dataset containing interval-censored observations treatment indicator (radiation vs. radiation plus chemotherapy). variables follows:

title: Breast Cosmesis Data — bcos
text: data frame 94 rows 3 variables: left Left endpoints censoring intervals (numeric). right Right endpoints censoring intervals (numeric). treatment factor levels "Rad" (radiation )       "RadChem" (radiation + chemotherapy).

title: Breast Cosmesis Data — bcos
text: data often used illustrate methods interval-censored survival analysis. Observations Inf right endpoint represent right-censored data.

title: Breast Cosmesis Data — bcos
code: data(bcos) head(bcos) #>   left right treatment #> 1   45   Inf       Rad #> 2    6    10       Rad #> 3    0     7       Rad #> 4   46   Inf       Rad #> 5   46   Inf       Rad #> 6    7    16       Rad

title: First Derivative Eta1 (Internal) — eta1G.f
text: Computes \(-epn \times H1(epn \times y)\), typically used partial derivatives log-likelihood.

title: First Derivative Eta1 (Internal) — eta1G.f
text: epn Numeric value, e.g., \(\exp(Z \beta)\). y Numeric scalar vector. H1 function. first derivative H.

title: First Derivative Eta1 (Internal) — eta1G.f
text: numeric value.

title: Second Derivative Eta2 (Internal) — eta2G.f
text: Computes \(-epn^2 \times H2(epn \times y)\).

title: Second Derivative Eta2 (Internal) — eta2G.f
text: epn Numeric value, e.g., \(\exp(Z \beta)\). y Numeric scalar vector. H2 function. second derivative H.

title: Second Derivative Eta2 (Internal) — eta2G.f
text: numeric value.

title: Fit Interval-Censored Model — icsurvfit
text: Fits interval-censored model various types (NP, PO, PH) iterating baseline regression parameter updates.

title: Fit Interval-Censored Model — icsurvfit
text: L Left endpoints (may contain NA, -Inf). R Right endpoints (may contain NA, Inf). Z matrix data frame covariates. model One "NP", "PO", "PH". Defaults "NP" nonparametric (covariates). maxiter Maximum number iterations fitting algorithm.

title: Fit Interval-Censored Model — icsurvfit
text: list (class "icsurvfit") components: beta Estimated regression coefficients (model="PO" "PH"). y Baseline function estimates time index. t Ordered time points y evaluated. var Estimated variance-covariance matrix beta (applicable). j Number iterations used. model specified model type. conv Logical indicating whether algorithm converged. varnames Covariate names. call Matched call.

title: Fit Interval-Censored Model — icsurvfit
text: NP Nonparametric (covariate effects). PO Proportional odds. PH Proportional hazards. Internally, function sets data, identifies observations left-, right-, interval-censored, calls various helper routines (e.g., profile1, NR2) perform iterative fitting.

title: Fit Interval-Censored Model — icsurvfit
code: # Simple example data(bcos)  n <- nrow(bcos) # sample size L <- bcos$left + rnorm(n, 0, 0.0001) # add random noise R <- bcos$right + rnorm(n, 0, 0.0001) Z <- as.numeric(bcos$treatment == "RadChem")  # Nonparametric obj_np <- icsurvfit(L, R)  # Cox model (PH) obj_ph <- icsurvfit(L, R, Z, model = "PH") obj_ph #>  #> Call: #> icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PH") #>  #> NPMLE of proportional hazards for interval-censored data: #>  #> ICM algorithm converges in 20 iterations. #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #>  #>      Estimate  StdErr z.value  p.value    #> [1,]  0.80580 0.30391  2.6514 0.008016 ** #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #> Call: #>   icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PH") #> #> NPMLE of proportional hazards for interval-censored data: #> #>   ICM algorithm converges in 20 iterations. #> #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #> #>   Estimate  StdErr z.value  p.value #> [1,]  0.78883 0.29344  2.6882 0.007183 ** #>   --- #>   Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1  # Proportional odds model (PO) obj_po <- icsurvfit(L, R, Z, model = "PO") obj_po #>  #> Call: #> icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PO") #>  #> NPMLE of proportional odds for interval-censored data: #>  #> ICM algorithm converges in 18 iterations. #>  #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #>  #>      Estimate  StdErr z.value p.value   #> [1,]  0.87562 0.41301  2.1201   0.034 * #> --- #> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1 #>  #> Call: #>   icsurvfit(L = L, R = R, Z = Z, model = "PO") #> #> NPMLE of proportional odds for interval-censored data: #> #>   ICM algorithm converges in 20 iterations. #> #> Maximum Likelihood Estimates for Regression parameters: #> #>   Estimate  StdErr z.value p.value #> [1,]  0.89529 0.41137  2.1764 0.02953 * #>   --- #>   Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1

title: Log-Likelihood Calculation (Internal) — lik.f2
text: Computes log-likelihood interval-censored data given current estimate parameter vector beta baseline functions Hf.

title: Log-Likelihood Calculation (Internal) — lik.f2
code: lik.f2(H, beta, y, delta, gamma, index, Z)

title: Log-Likelihood Calculation (Internal) — lik.f2
text: H function representing transformed baseline function \(H(x) = \exp(-G(x))\). beta Numeric vector regression coefficients. y Numeric vector baseline-related parameters. delta, gamma Numeric 0/1 vectors indicating left interval censoring status. index 2-column integer matrix mapping subject's interval indices y. Z matrix data frame covariates.

title: Log-Likelihood Calculation (Internal) — lik.f2
text: numeric value log-likelihood.

what: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
title: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
text: Processes interval-censored data (corresponding indicators) produce ordered set exam times flags indicating censoring status. also adjusts certain delta gamma values based constraints first observation always event time, last observation always right-censored.

title: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
text: delta Numeric (0/1). Event indicator left endpoint U. gamma Numeric (0/1). Event indicator right endpoint V. U Numeric vector left endpoints censoring intervals (may contain NA). V Numeric vector right endpoints censoring intervals (may contain NA). Z matrix (data frame) covariates, one row per subject.

title: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
text: list following components: t condensed, ordered set exam times. index matrix dimension n x 2, giving ranks (indices)        U V ordering. data matrix (data frame) containing updated        delta, gamma, U, V, Z values.

title: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
text: function ensures earliest recorded time t corresponds left endpoint truly event, latest recorded time right-censored. also removes observations longer valid adjustments. vector flag used internally mark observation types (1 = event, 2 = left-censored, 3 = , 4 = right-censored).

title: Order and Rank Interval-Censored Data — order_rank
code: # (Not run) Example usage (requires suitable data) # delta <- c(1, 0, 0) # gamma <- c(0, 1, 0) # U <- c(2, 2, 3) # V <- c(NA, 4, 5) # Z <- matrix(rnorm(9), nrow = 3) # order_rank(delta, gamma, U, V, Z)

what: Plot Method for icsurvfit Objects — plot.icsurvfit
title: Plot Method for icsurvfit Objects — plot.icsurvfit
text: Plots estimated survival function icsurvfit object. model="NP", nonparametric estimate plotted. model="PO" "PH", survival curve specific covariate value z can overlaid. default, plots step function.

title: Plot Method for icsurvfit Objects — plot.icsurvfit
code: # S3 method for class 'icsurvfit' plot(   object,   z = NULL,   xlab = "Time",   ylab = "Survival rate",   lty = 1,   frame.plot = FALSE,   add = FALSE,   ylim = c(0, 1),   ... )

title: Plot Method for icsurvfit Objects — plot.icsurvfit
text: object object class "icsurvfit" returned icsurvfit. z Numeric (vector ) covariate values plot survival curve. NULL (default) model nonparametric, plots baseline curve. xlab, ylab Axis labels. lty Line type. Default 1. frame.plot Logical indicating whether draw box around plot. add Logical indicating whether add curve existing plot. FALSE (default), new plot created. ylim Numeric vector length 2 specifying \(y\)-axis range. ... Additional graphical parameters passed plot lines.

what: Print Method for icsurvfit Objects — print.icsurvfit
title: Print Method for icsurvfit Objects — print.icsurvfit
text: Prints summary fitted model, including call, convergence status, estimated survival function (model="NP"), estimated regression coefficients (model="PO" "PH").

title: Print Method for icsurvfit Objects — print.icsurvfit
Print Method for icsurvfit Objects — print.icsurvfit
text: object object class "icsurvfit" returned icsurvfit. ... arguments passed methods. currently used.

title: Profile Update for y (Internal) — profile1
text: Performs iterative update y vector given current estimates baseline function Hf regression parameter beta. Uses function CSD.f2 compute partial derivatives, applies convex minorant function CM.

title: Profile Update for y (Internal) — profile1
code: profile1(Hf, beta, yini, delta, gamma, index, Z, eps = 1e-04, maxiter = 100)

title: Profile Update for y (Internal) — profile1
text: Hf list functions (H, H1, H2) defining baseline hazard (similar). beta Numeric vector regression coefficients. yini Initial guess y. delta, gamma Numeric 0/1 vectors indicating left interval censoring status. index 2-column integer matrix mapping subject's interval indices y. Z matrix data frame covariates. eps Convergence tolerance iterative algorithm. maxiter Maximum number iterations perform.

title: Profile Update for y (Internal) — profile1
text: numeric vector y updated estimate   iterative procedure.

title: Higher-Level Profile Update (Internal) — profile2
text: Repeatedly calls profile1 update y, converging solution based current beta baseline hazard functions Hf.

title: Higher-Level Profile Update (Internal) — profile2
code: profile2(Hf, y, beta, delta, gamma, index, Z, eps = 1e-04, maxiter = 100)

title: Higher-Level Profile Update (Internal) — profile2
text: Hf list functions (H, H1, H2) defining baseline hazard (similar). beta Numeric vector regression coefficients. delta, gamma Numeric 0/1 vectors indicating left interval censoring status. index 2-column integer matrix mapping subject's interval indices y. Z matrix data frame covariates. eps Convergence tolerance iterative algorithm. maxiter Maximum number iterations perform.

title: Higher-Level Profile Update (Internal) — profile2
text: final log-likelihood (numeric) convergence.

what: Quadratic Approximation for Profile Likelihood (Internal) — quad.profile2
title: Quadratic Approximation for Profile Likelihood (Internal) — quad.profile2
text: Approximates information matrix via finite differences perturbing beta dimension, re-profiling y, computing difference log-likelihood.

title: Quadratic Approximation for Profile Likelihood (Internal) — quad.profile2
code: quad.profile2(   n,   Hf,   beta,   y,   delta,   gamma,   index,   Z,   eps = 1e-04,   maxiter = 100 )

title: Quadratic Approximation for Profile Likelihood (Internal) — quad.profile2
text: n Sample size, used scale perturbations ptb = 1/sqrt(n). Hf list functions (H, H1, H2) defining baseline hazard. beta Numeric vector regression coefficients. y Numeric vector baseline parameters (updated profile1). delta, gamma Numeric 0/1 vectors indicating left interval censoring status. index 2-column integer matrix mapping subject's interval indices y. Z matrix data frame covariates. eps Convergence tolerance iterative algorithm. maxiter Maximum number iterations perform.

title: Quadratic Approximation for Profile Likelihood (Internal) — quad.profile2
text: p x p matrix, approximation negative Hessian (information).

title: Inverse Log-Transform Function Constructor (Internal) — trans_inv
text: Creates inverse function transformations constructed trans_log.

title: Inverse Log-Transform Function Constructor (Internal) — trans_inv
text: gamma Numeric scalar. 0, inverse transform identity function.

title: Inverse Log-Transform Function Constructor (Internal) — trans_inv
text: single function, Ginv, computes inverse transform.

title: Log-Transform Functions Constructor (Internal) — trans_log
text: Creates list transformation functions derivatives based parameter gamma. Used transform (invert) data estimation routines.

title: Log-Transform Functions Constructor (Internal) — trans_log
text: gamma Numeric scalar. gamma = 0, transform identity; otherwise, log-based transform used.

title: Log-Transform Functions Constructor (Internal) — trans_log
text: list 5 functions: transform[[1]] main transform. transform[[2]] first derivative transform. transform[[3]] second derivative. transform[[4]] third derivative. transform[[5]] fourth derivative.

title: First Derivative of Beta (xi1) (Internal) — xi1G.f
text: Computes \(-z \times epn \times y \times H1(epn \times y)\), used partial derivative w.r.t. beta.

title: First Derivative of Beta (xi1) (Internal) — xi1G.f
text: epn Numeric, e.g. \(\exp(Z \beta)\). z Numeric vector, representing covariate(s). y Numeric, typically \(y[j]\) iterative algorithms. H1 function, first derivative H.

title: First Derivative of Beta (xi1) (Internal) — xi1G.f
text: numeric value xi1.

title: Second Derivative of Beta (xi2) (Internal) — xi2G.f
text: Computes \(-z z^T \times epn \times y \times (H1(epn \times y) + y \times epn \times H2(epn \times y))\).

title: Second Derivative of Beta (xi2) (Internal) — xi2G.f
text: epn Numeric, e.g. \(\exp(Z \beta)\). z Numeric vector, representing covariate(s) (possibly multiple dimensions). y Numeric, typically \(y[j]\). H1, H2 Functions, first second derivatives H.

title: Second Derivative of Beta (xi2) (Internal) — xi2G.f
text: matrix numeric value, second derivative term.

title: Zeta1 Calculation (Internal) — zeta1.f
text: Computes \(Fd^{-2} \times \eta1^2 - Fd^{-1} \times \eta2\), used partial derivatives.

title: Zeta1 Calculation (Internal) — zeta1.f
text: Fd Numeric value, typically FdG.f(epn, y, H). eta1 Numeric value, typically eta1G.f(epn, y, H1). eta2 Numeric value, typically eta2G.f(epn, y, H2).

title: Zeta1 Calculation (Internal) — zeta1.f
text: numeric value zeta1 term.

title: Zeta21 Calculation (Internal) — zeta21.f
text: Computes \((Fd2 - Fd1)^{-2} \times \eta1^2 + (Fd2 - Fd1)^{-1} \times \eta2\).

title: Zeta21 Calculation (Internal) — zeta21.f
text: Fd1 Numeric value (lower bound CDF). Fd2 Numeric value (upper bound CDF). eta1 Numeric, e.g., eta1G.f(epn, x, H1). eta2 Numeric, e.g., eta2G.f(epn, x, H2).

title: Zeta21 Calculation (Internal) — zeta21.f
text: numeric value zeta21 term.

title: Zeta22 Calculation (Internal) — zeta22.f
text: Computes \((Fd2 - Fd1)^{-2} \times \eta1^2 - (Fd2 - Fd1)^{-1} \times \eta2\).

title: Zeta22 Calculation (Internal) — zeta22.f
text: Fd1 Numeric value (lower bound CDF). Fd2 Numeric value (upper bound CDF). eta1 Numeric, e.g., eta1G.f(epn, x, H1). eta2 Numeric, e.g., eta2G.f(epn, x, H2).

title: Zeta22 Calculation (Internal) — zeta22.f
text: numeric value zeta22 term.

title: Zeta3CR Calculation (Internal) — zeta3CR.f
text: Computes \((ext - Fd)^{-2} \times \eta1^2 + (ext - Fd)^{-1} \times \eta2\).

title: Zeta3CR Calculation (Internal) — zeta3CR.f
text: Fd Numeric value. eta1 Numeric value. eta2 Numeric value. ext Numeric scalar, external parameter bound (e.g., 1).

title: Zeta3CR Calculation (Internal) — zeta3CR.f
text: numeric value zeta3 term.
